name: Aiguaclara Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for one week at the Hotel Aiguaclara in Begur in June 2008. We booked the Junior Suite Aiguaclara, which has a large, east facing balcony with two deckchairs, a table and chairs.
reviews.title: Highly recommended, beautiful hotel

likes.liked: — The owners' attention to detail and friendliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel late morning to be warmly greeted by Joan. He proudly showed us around the hotel and we were very impressed with the courtyard, the basement lounge (with a selection of CDs), the two honesty bars, the reading room and the restaurant.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, can't wait to return !
Wonderful romantic hotel
reviews.text: Our room was very well laid out and beautifully decorated. The room consisted of a hallway, the bedroom, a large bathroom and a balcony. The hallway contained a sofa and a bureau for storage purposes. The main bedroom had one big wardrobe, two comfy seats, a TV and a CD player. Both rooms had doorways onto the large terrace. The bathroom was large with a huge sink, a bidet, a loo and an excellent shower over the bath. The king sized bed was very comfortable.

reviews.title: superb
reviews.text: We later met Clara, Joan’s wife who again greeted us very warmly with kisses on both cheeks. She then handed us a pile of English magazines to read at our leisure. This was very thoughtful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every morning at breakfast Joan came around the tables asking if everyone was ok, what you had done the previous day and what you were doing that day. The couple were always on hand to provide advice and maps on the area, recommend beaches and villages to explore.
reviews.title: romantic place
Fantastic Stay!
reviews.text: Having been lucky enough to stay in some excellent hotels in the past (for a lot more money!) this place must be right up there. Our laid back hosts were brilliant and couldn't be more helpful during our stay offering plenty of good advice regarding restaurants and places to visit. They also have amazing taste in terms of the decor throughout the hotel which has been sympathetically restored in keeping with this beautiful town. A great place for a chilled out weekend where you're made to feel like it's your home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent eight days in Catalonia, staying in four hotels, the best of which was unquestionably Hotel Aiguaclara.
reviews.title: True Catalan Hospitality

likes.liked: — The genuine hospitality of the hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived we were quietly pampered by Joan and Clara who really do treat their guests as if they were family friends.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved the Aiguaclara hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is a charming 19th century town house with airy, high-ceilinged rooms and views of the medieval castle from most of the comfortable bedrooms, which retain many of their original features.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the hotel restaurant was not open on the two evenings of our stay the menu was very enticing and full of promise. If the breakfast was typical of the quality of the food we were sorry to have missed dinner.
reviews.title: Fabulous room and welcome

likes.disliked: — Quite loud morning chat on street side rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel in Begur following the positive reviews it had on tripadvisor website. We weren't disappointed. It is an old traditional Catalan building, lovingly converted to a 10bedroom hotel by it's owners, Clara and Joan. There is therefore no lift or double glazing but apart from these minor problems (for us) it was totally perfect.
reviews.title: Home from home.

description: You'll feel like at home in this family hotel, wich is run by Clara and Joan, its owners. A 1866 Colonial mansion with 10 rooms, restaurant, bar, garden... Located in Begur centre, the best village to explore the Costa Brava. Close to the best beaches, 20 minutes from 5 golf courses, 45 minutes from Girona Airport and 1 hour and a half from Barcelona.
